name: Postman Generator Attributes
description: Specification contains various ApiBuilder attributes, which are recognized by Postman Collection Generator

attribute_name.description: A set of attribute names, that are recognized by Postman Generator

basic_auth.description: Attribute instructs the generator to add Basic Auth info to the whole Postman collection. Attribute should be defined on the root level of the ApiBuilder specification

fields.name: username
fields.description: Specifies the username to be used in Postman Collection auth definition. It may be also a variable reference.

fields.name: password
fields.description: Specified the password to be used in Postman Collection auth definition. It may be also a variable reference. Leave this string empty, when only a username is needed.

object_reference.description: Attribute instructs the generator to add a setup step with the referenced entity creation. This attribute should be attached to the field (that holds an identifier) inside model or to the resource path (that holds one path param).

fields.name: related_service_namespace
fields.description: ApiBuilder service's namespace, in which a target operation is specified.

fields.name: resource_type
fields.description: Resource type, that holds a referenced operation.

fields.name: identifier_field
fields.description: A field name. When the referenced operation is called, identifier_field is used to extract the corresponding field from the response JSON.

fields.name: delete_operation_path
fields.description: Optionally, the referenced entity's DELETE operation path can be put here. This needs to be a full operation path (taken from the service.json). If specified, the generator will add a cleanup step for the referenced object.

value_substitute.description: Attribute instructs the generator to substitute a field value (when generating examples) with specified value or variable reference. Attribute should be attached to a field inside model.

fields.name: substitute
fields.description: Value, which will be put into the field marked by this attribute. It may be also a variable reference.
